data.text: @lassidawg33 @haagsolutions @wiaawa Totally agree! But some people are never happy no matter what.
@wsucougs2000 @haagsolutions @wiaawa People conveniently forget WIAA also has to manage the sport for the majority of schools that don’t make state.

@wsucougs2000 @haagsolutions @wiaawa I know you and I aren’t opposite on this but it amazes me the angst toward any format.  There is no perfect format.  Bottom line win all your games in the post season and you will be the state champ.  Also need to keep in mind the vast majority of schools never make it to state.

@haagsolutions @jdoster06 @wiaawa Who is they if by they you mean all of the schools.  The WIAA isn’t a private organization it is a co-op of all the schools in the state.   Let’s keep in mind Basketball isn’t the only sport, so why don’t you go ahead and figure out how to allocate state berths in all sports.

@haagsolutions @lassidawg33 @wiaawa Regionals were February 25-26. State is this week. With the format that started about 15 years ago, this is how it’s worked. Luckily they are changing the format next year. https://t.co/NxQXmp0BfE

@haagsolutions @lassidawg33 @wiaawa Last week was regionals. All post season games are sold as state because it’s the start of postseason play. State started today and 12 teams were still in for each bracket. 8 teams play loser out games today and four teams for byes into tomorrows games.
@haagsolutions @lassidawg33 @wiaawa Who is UHigh? Umm basketball. I only do baseball now.
@wsucougs2000 @lassidawg33 @wiaawa Regionals was sold as state. Again, by your metrics, only 8 make state. That's all that is guaranteed.
@wsucougs2000 @lassidawg33 @wiaawa UHigh is a home game?  Tell me when UHigh played last in a regional. A former official? Of?

@haagsolutions @lassidawg33 @wiaawa All higher seeded teams played at courts in their home city. Lower seeded teams all had to travel. That’s the way it’s worked since they got rid of the 16 team state tournament. Im a former official, so I’m well aware of the process.
